climatePledgeFriendly.details: Compact by Design (Certified by Amazon) products remove excess air and water, which reduces the carbon footprint of shipping and packaging.

features: 100% CERTIFIED ORGANIC COTTON: Cora’s non-applicator tampons are comfortable, highly-absorbent, hypoallergenic and made with GOTS certified organic cotton because what you put in your body matters. Note: Packaging May Vary

BODY-CENTRIC DESIGN BY AND FOR WOMEN: Expands to fit your body for total comfort and leak-protection, so you can move fearlessly from downward dog to white denim! Woven cord provides an added leak protection barrier.

APPLICATOR FREE, LESS WASTE: Comfortable, sleek, and eco-conscious. Easy no applicator digital insertion with rounded tip. High comfort and low environmental impact. The best of both worlds. Compact design for on the go period care.

POWERFUL PRODUCTS FOR POWERFUL BODIES, PERIOD: Every Cora purchase provides access to period care and health education to women in need worldwide. Together, we’ve donated over 10 million pads and counting!

FSA/HSA ELIGIBLE: Cora products can now be purchased with pre-tax dollars from your flexible spending or health savings accounts. Cora strives to offer pesticide-free, bleach-free, fragrance-free, toxin-free, rayon-free and non-GMO period care for all women.

Period Patch Vulva Balm Boric Acid Period Long Liners Improved Bladder Liners New Product from Cora! Promotes Period Comfort Use Anywhere On The Body Supports pH Balance Added Protection When Using Boric Acid

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My kids called Cora so had to buy
reviews.reviewText: There organic and better for the body my 16 year old won’t buy anything else so I will keep buying of course

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Read the Product Description
reviews.reviewText: -First I want to say, read the product description ladies, these are non-applicator tampons. Most of the reviews that were less than 5 stars state it is because they don't have an applicator. That being said, they are my favorite ones I've found!-I switched to organic cotton and chemical free tampons about a year ago and am glad I did. I have had much less itching since switching.-While I like the idea of using a menstrual cup because it takes the waste created by feminine hygiene products to 0, I have tried using cups in the past and I just don't think they are for me.-So then I got to thinking, what else could I do to reduce waste created during my cycle and I remembered some tampons come applicator free. And ladies, why do we need an applicator anyway? I remember when I was 11 or 12 (I started menstruating at age 11) I asked my mom why one box of tampons was so much smaller than the other boxes on the isle and I remember her saying "Well, they don't have an applicator." So I asked her, "Well how do you get them in?" And she responded, "You use your finger," and made a face that seemed to say, "ewww, gross.". Well, one thing I noticed when I switched to organic cotton and chemical free tampons and that sometimes they tend to "hang on" to the applicator after inserted and when I pull out the applicator the tampon comes out with it. And what do you do in this situation? You use your finger to put it back in. So what is the point of the applicator if you are going to have to use your finger anyway? So for me this was an easy decision to switch to non-applicator tampons. They have so much less waste than traditional applicator tampons. The tampon itself seems a lot smaller but I think thats because it's shrink wrapped. Once it contacts moisture it expands to the same size as the applicator tampon.-All in all my hippie heart feels better knowing there is so much less waste with these tampons and I have not been bothered by the switch at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than others I've used
reviews.reviewText: I've used OB for 30 years, but the pandemic caused supply chain issues that meant being unable to find them in the stores. I saw this brand online and gave it a try and am so happy I did as I like these more than OB. These are denser and stiffer, making them easier to use, and I do not feel them while in use. I'll be ordering more of these going forward.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I am always looking for ways to reduce waste and plastic in my life. Menstrual products are an area that I’ve struggled to find a good balance of performance/comfort and low environmental impact. Then along came Cora Tampons.First off the bat, they come in a tiny little box! Seriously so small! Even less waste. The tampons are easy to unwrap and are tiny themselves. I found the lack of an applicator to be a non-issue. It’s easy to insert and no pinchy applicator creating more plastic waste. I’ve found these to be the most comfortable tampons I’ve used, ever. Not sure if it’s the size or shape, but I can’t feel these and I usually can other tampon brands and that’s super uncomfortable. But not only are Cora tampons comfortable to use, I’ve found the absorption to be better than the conventional big name tampon brands. Plus on top of all that, they’re 100% organic cotton which I feel good about putting in my body and in my support of organic cotton production. These are my brand from now on!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Will definitely continue to use these.
reviews.reviewText: I had never used applicator-free tampons before these, so there is a bit of a learning curve. Once you get the hang of it, they’re really easy to use. They are a bit harder or more dense than a normal tampon that comes in an applicator, but you can’t feel that once you’ve got it in. I love that these are so small and they’re made from organic cotton so you’re putting good material in your body. Also, save the planet & ditch those applicators! I like to use these on days where I have a lighter flow and I don’t necessarily feel like using my menstrual cup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Organic and sustainable! I got these to use with my Dame tampon set, and they work great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: I normally use the OB brand tampons, but am having a hard time finding them at all. These are a great alternative brand! They are super similar and very discreet and easy to use. They don’t feel plasticy like some other tampons.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and organic
reviews.reviewText: I found these tampons to be easier to use and more comfortable that the o.b. regular fluid lock tampons. Definitely will continue purchasing!
